trial_identification.studytitle: Adrenergic control of protein and fat metabolism in healthy adults
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Impact of beta2-adrenergic stimulation on protein and fat metabolism in healthy adults

conditioncode.conditioncode2: Normal metabolism and endocrine development and function

interventions.interventions: Oral administration of a beta2-agonist (oral formoterol tablet 160 mg daily for 1 week)
interventions.comparator: Changes in metabolism are compared before and after treatment in the same subject

eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Any active medical conditions necessitating medication

trial_design.concealment: Subjects are screened for eligibility by clinical history, physical examination and laboratory blood tests (full blood count, renal function, liver function). Eligible subjects are invited to participate in the study.

sponsorship.primarysponsorname: National Health and Medical Research Council
sponsorship.primarysponsoraddress: National Health and Medical Research Council National Institute of Clinical Studies GPO Box 4530 Melbourne Vic 3001

fundingsource.fundingname: National Health and Medical Research Council
fundingsource.fundingaddress: National Health and Medical Research Council National Institute of Clinical Studies GPO Box 4530 Melbourne Vic 3001

ethicsAndSummary.summary: The study objective is to investigate the metabolic effects of beta2-agonist in humans, including whole body energy expenditure, fat oxidation, protein synthesis and turnover

ethicscommitee.ethicname: St Vincent's Hospital Human Research Ethics Committee
ethicscommitee.ethicaddress: St Vincent's Hospital Victoria Street Darlinghurst NSW 2010
